New Records: Sri Lanka on 7 August created history as they defeated India in a bilateral ODI series after a gap of 27 years.
Dunith Wellalage has become the first spinner to take five wickets in an ODI against India on more than one occasion.
Key Match Events: Charith Asalanka-led Sri Lanka defeated Rohit Sharma-led India by 110 runs in the third ODI match at Colombo.
India were all out for 138 runs in just 26.1 overs.
Dunith Wellalage picked up 5 wickets, while Maheesh Theekshana and Jeffrey Vandersay took 2 wickets each.
Asitha Fernando was awarded the player of the match, while Dunith Wellalage won the player of the series.
Sri Lanka's Avishka Fernando scored 96 off 102 balls, while Kusal Mendis (59) and Pathum Nissanka (45) contributed with their bat.
Riyan Parag took three wickets for India.
Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma's men were looking to avoid losing the series when they took on hosts Sri Lanka in the penultimate match of the 3-match ODI series.
The surface in Colombo was favouring the slower bowlers, leading to Riyan Parag making his international debut primarily as a bowler.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lankan skipper Charith Asalanka expressed happiness, stating the team did all things right throughout the series and credited their strength in spin.
Indian skipper Rohit Sharma acknowledged the need to look at individual and game plan improvements, giving credit to Sri Lanka for playing better.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India lost 27 wickets to spin, the most by any team in a bilateral ODI series.
Sri Lanka had 6 players injured and unable to play in the series.
